page.title: 12Industry C.A.V.
page.content: C.A.V. arrived in Sudbury in 1942.The original factory being in North Street. The present factory,the third,was built in 1964.C.A.V. is the largest employer in Sudbury employing over 2,200 people. C.A.V. makes filters,nozzles and injectors for diesel engines.The machines are accurate to a thousandth of a millimetre.They produce 4 million injectors a year.The firm has its own Training School for new employers,its own restaurant,fire service and security .The firms Services Dept. check heating ,lighting,fuel and condition of machines.A pleasant working environment in a large,spacious,well planned factory is encouraged and there are also indoor and outdoor leisure facilities for all workers.The firm has its own Medical Dept.,bank,computer room and strong union to ensure good conditions.
